metas.name: Daniel Tiger's Neighborhood
metas.description: Similar to Peg + Cat and Doc McStuffins, this show focuses on social-emotional learning and everyday life lessons through music and relatable characters.

metas.name: Wild Kratts
metas.description: For fans of The Magic School Bus and Ada Twist, Scientist, this show combines animation and live-action to teach children about animals and ecosystems.

metas.name: Sid the Science Kid
metas.description: An educational show like Ada Twist, Scientist, it encourages curiosity and scientific thinking through the everyday questions of its young protagonist.

metas.name: The Octonauts
metas.description: Similar to WordGirl and Special Agent Oso in its adventurous spirit, this animated series teaches children about marine life and ocean exploration.

metas.name: Super Why!
metas.description: A literacy-focused show like WordGirl, it uses fairy tales and interactive storytelling to help children learn to read and solve problems.

metas.name: T.U.F.F. Puppy
metas.description: If they enjoy the humor and action of WordGirl, this animated comedy about a canine secret agent offers similar lighthearted adventures.

metas.name: Chuggington
metas.description: For fans of Clifford the Big Red Dog and Curious George, this animated series follows a group of young trains learning valuable lessons about teamwork and responsibility.

metas.name: Pocoyo
metas.description: With its simple animation and focus on basic concepts, similar to Numberblocks and Peg + Cat, this show is engaging for very young children.

metas.name: Sarah & Duck
metas.description: This gentle animated show, like Bluey and Curious George, explores everyday wonders and imaginative play with a calm and charming demeanor.

metas.name: Molly of Denali
metas.description: Combining animation and live-action, this show similar to Ada Twist, Scientist, introduces children to Alaskan Native culture and promotes critical thinking.

metas.name: Ask the StoryBots
metas.description: An educational and musical series like Peg + Cat and Ada Twist, Scientist, it answers kids' biggest questions in a fun and animated way.

metas.name: If You Give a Mouse a Cookie
metas.description: Based on beloved books, this animated series shares charming stories with positive messages, akin to Bluey and Curious George.

metas.name: Go, Diego, Go!
metas.description: Similar to Dora the Explorer (which they might have seen or enjoyed similar educational elements from), this show focuses on animals and problem-solving in nature.

metas.name: Octonauts: Above & Beyond
metas.description: An extension of The Octonauts, this series continues to explore the natural world with a focus on rescue and environmentalism.

metas.name: Xavier Riddle and the Secret Museum
metas.description: This educational animated series, much like Ada Twist, Scientist, teaches history through fun adventures with historical figures.

metas.name: The Cat in the Hat Knows a Lot About That!
metas.description: Combining science and silliness, similar to The Magic School Bus and Peg + Cat, this show explores scientific concepts through Dr. Seuss characters.

metas.name: Puppy Dog Pals
metas.description: With its focus on adventure and problem-solving, this animated series is a good follow-up for fans of Special Agent Oso and Clifford the Big Red Dog.

metas.name: Sesame Street
metas.description: A classic educational show that covers a wide range of topics, from numbers and letters to emotions, fitting with the spirit of Numberblocks and Peg + Cat.

metas.name: Hey Duggee
metas.description: A charming and educational preschool series that encourages teamwork and learning through fun activities, reminiscent of Doc McStuffins' positive lessons.

metas.name: Tilly and Friends
metas.description: This gentle animated show focuses on friendship and emotional understanding, fitting well with the themes in Bluey and Doc McStuffins.

metas.name: The Lion Guard
metas.description: A spin-off of The Lion King, this animated series focuses on adventure and problem-solving within a conservation context, similar to the educational aspects of WordGirl.

metas.name: Stretch Armstrong & the Flex Fighters
metas.description: If they enjoy the action-adventure of WordGirl, this animated series offers a superhero narrative with teamwork and positive themes, suitable for older kids.

metas.name: Odd Squad
metas.description: Combining live-action and animation, this show teaches math and science concepts through quirky investigations, appealing to the problem-solving nature of Ada Twist, Scientist and WordGirl.

metas.name: Guess with Jess
metas.description: A gentle animated series that encourages curiosity and learning about the world, similar to Curious George and Clifford the Big Red Dog.

metas.name: Costume Quest
metas.description: Based on a video game, this animated series offers adventure and problem-solving with a lighthearted tone, suitable for fans of WordGirl's action.

metas.name: Shaun the Sheep
metas.description: This stop-motion animated series is full of physical comedy and clever problem-solving without dialogue, appealing to the observational humor of Bluey and the inventive spirit of WordGirl.

metas.name: Emily's Wonder Lab
metas.description: This live-action science show, similar to Ada Twist, Scientist and The Magic School Bus, encourages hands-on experiments and exploration for young viewers.

metas.name: Ollie's Pack
metas.description: This animated series features a young boy who discovers a magical backpack filled with creatures and adventures, similar to the problem-solving and fantasy elements of WordGirl and The Magic School Bus.

metas.name: Hilda
metas.description: While this show has some fantasy elements, it is generally appropriate for children and focuses on adventure, exploration, and friendship, similar to the imaginative spirit of The Magic School Bus and the charm of Bluey.

metas.name: The Amazing World of Gumball
metas.description: This animated comedy series offers a unique blend of humor and surreal situations that can appeal to children who enjoy witty and imaginative shows like WordGirl and Bluey.

metas.name: Arthur
metas.description: A long-running animated series that focuses on the everyday lives and challenges of elementary school children, offering relatable social and emotional lessons similar to Daniel Tiger's Neighborhood and Doc McStuffins.
